SDG_GOAL: Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns
SDG_TARGET: 12.4 By 2020, achieve environmentally sound management of chemicals and all wastes throughout their life cycle, in accordance with internationally agreed guidelines, and significantly reduce their release to air , water and soil, in order to minimize their negative effects on health and the environment
SDG_INDICATOR: 12.4.2. Percentage of identified treatment sites are operational before 2018 and the maximum before 2025
CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Ministry of Transport, Public Works, Equipment and Land Use Planning (MTTPEAT)
CONTACT_FUNCT: Focal point for the production of the Ministry's SDGs
STAT_CONC_DEF: This is the percentage of functional waste treatment sites compared to all existing waste treatment sites
SOURCE_TYPE: The indicator comes from administrative data
COLL_METHOD: Ratio of functional waste treatment sites to all existing waste treatment sites
INST_MANDATE: SETEMU is the body recognized by the Burundian government as municipal technical services
RATIONALE: This indicator is relevant because it highlights the percentage of functional waste treatment sites compared to all existing waste treatment sites.
DATA_COMP: Ratio of functional waste treatment sites to all existing waste treatment sites
COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
